Posts.Content: Mar 5, 2011 08:33AM mintchocchip wrote: Hi All, I had my BMX w/TE on Feb 7th.  Its been a bumpy road for me so far.  I got an infection in my left (non cancerous) breast right after surgery.  It got bright red, very tight and painfull.  My advice to others is if you think something isnt right stay on the doctors.  The third time was a charm for me and I ended up in the hospital for 4 days on Vancomycin antibiotic.  I am now taking the Vanco at home for 7 additional days.  This has backed up my expansion and the pending radiation plans.  The surgery itself wasnt bad at all, just a little stiff moving the arms as I had 21 lymph nodes removed on right side.  Cotton Tank tops that were a size or two larger were the after surgery ticket. CELTICSGIRL - thanks so much for the encouraging words at a time when I really needed to hear positive re-inforcement. Loving hugs to you all and best wishes for speedy recovery and most excellent futures,  Denise

Posts.Content: Jun 5, 2011 10:58AM mintchocchip wrote: Hi  All...Started Rads in May and am down to last 4.  Initially I was overwhelmed with the thought of 31 treatments, now find it went really fast.  My armpit is the the only area that is irritated and blistered.  I also found that using Aquaphor really helped.  Also never wiped radiated area with towel only blotted after shower.  Used vitamin E oil  on mornings I had to go to work, found it soaks into skin and isnt so greasy.
